page.title: 03FARMING CULLOMPTON
page.content: Dairy farming is very important here. We visited Mr.Arbery's farm at{ {Mutterton.}He keeps 41 Friesian cows and 35 young stock.Day starts at 06.15,milking at 06.45.Cows are milked by machine in milking parlour.Milk is kept at 4'c. until collected by tanker. Finishing milking at 08.30,farmer works around farm until evening milking at 17.00.Busiest time of year is mid May to mid June because of hay and silage making. Good cow costs Â£600 and is fed on grass,silage,hay and sugar_beet.Mr.Arbery has been given an annual quota of 25 288 because of the new E.E.C.regulations.He is against this as it cuts his profits.
